alert.note: Alert for Inland Southern Brevard; Mainland Southern Brevard; Osceola; Southern Brevard Barrier Islands (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 29 at 3:31PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Brevard and northeastern Osceola Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 331 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles northwest of Camp Holly Fish Camp, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Rockledge, Cocoa Beach, Merritt Island, Suntree and Viera. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. These types of funnel clouds are harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Inland Southern Brevard; Mainland Southern Brevard; Osceola; Southern Brevard Barrier Islands
